snippet: An analysis shows that House Democrats who voted in favor of a bill that will roll back a key provision of the Dodd-Frank law on average received nearly four times as much money from large financial institutions as others who voted “no.”
abstract: An analysis shows that House Democrats who voted in favor of a bill that will roll back a key provision of the Dodd-Frank law on average received nearly four times as much money from large financial institutions as others who voted “no.”

headline.main: Wall St. Had Invested Heavily in Dodd-Frank Changes

keywords.value: Dodd-Frank Wall Street Reform and Consumer Protection Act (2010)
keywords.name: subject
